title: Omicron Variant Found on Flights Reveals Gaps in Covid-19 Travel Rules
sub_head: Dozens of passengers on two flights from South Africa to the Netherlands tested positive for Covid-19, with at least 13 found with the new variant
body:
The probe into two flights from South Africa to the Netherlands, on which more than a dozen people tested positive for the newly discovered Omicron variant, reveal gaps in the patchwork of current travel measures now in place to contain the coronavirus.
Of around 600 passengers on the two flights, 61 tested positive for Covid-19 after being taken off the planes, held for hours in an isolated part of Amsterdamâ€™s Schiphol airport and tested. Sunday morning, Dutch health authorities said that at least 13 were confirmed as the Omicron variant, a new strain first identified in southern Africa.
